metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5093 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A heap buffer overflow vulnerability may occur in WebAssembly during Memory/Table resizing, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 58.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5093` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine chrisccoulson> This is not fixed in mozjs52, but it's unclear whether it is unaffected or just ignored as the bug is still private. See https://hg.mozilla.org/releases/mozilla-release/rev/622c05a8e7a1

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
